intro: Staurochilus gibbosicalcar, commonly known as the horned rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture, while its stems are often covered in short, glandular hairs. Staurochilus gibbosicalcar is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
